availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Ann Snead. Father of William J. Thurmond, James M. Thurmond, Elizabeth Anne Thurmond, P. J. Thurmond, F. S. Thurmond, Israel Snead Thurmond, Mary J. Thurmond, Martin C. Thurmond, Phillip G. Thurmond, and Pernecia H. Thurmond. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 257B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, pp. 465-466.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 359.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 4.
